channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Banded Vechile, 6th September
item.description:
White transit van has been abandoned on public road behind our back garden gates. since July ,had not moved at all and recently have heard the doors been opened very early Iin the morning and late at night. Have seen a person coining from the van. This vechijw has to be removed , it’s untaxed and has no MOT.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nuthatch Gardens, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead fox, 6th September
item.description:
There is a bike by the garden gate at the side of number 13. A fox has climbed inside the waterproof cover and died.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St Paul's Terrace, Elephant and Castle, London

item.title: Dog fouling, 6th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Halt Robin Road, Lower Belvedere, London

item.title: Two black bags thrown to the middle of the street, 6th September
item.description:
Someone threw two bags during the night in middle of Page Heath Lane. Both have what seems to be plants inside. During the morning someone put the bags out of the street and place them close to our property.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London

item.title: Light off for months now, 5th September

item.title: Alarm going of for over 4 hours, 5th September
item.description:
Not sure where it is but on the gayhurst blocks there is a smoke or fire alarm going of for over 4 hours could even be more I’m not sure if it’s in someone’s house or one of the many empty houses on the block if you stand outside doorway 39 to 42 you can hear it and also if you stand on the grass that is in the middle of the 4 blocks , can’t see any smoke or fire This can continue all night please could someone look into this
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hopwood Road, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: ANOTHER mattress, bin and rubbish, 5th September
item.description:
Around the corner from the other report is more fly tipping including a blue mattress on the edge of the green space and road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Evering Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Graffiti covering a shutter at 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. The graffiti covers both sides of a shutter its against a black background., 5th September
item.description:
Please can something be done to remove graffiti from a shutter. It is very large and only attacts more people to spray on this particular street which we have been having a major problem with recently concerning graffiti. The graffiti is fairly large done against a black background. The graffiti covers both front and side sections of the shutter. The location is 296-298 Brixton road SW9 6AG. The graffiti has been there for over a week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 296,298, Brixton Road, Brixton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bickley Lido, 5th September
item.description:
There has been a flooding problem for years just outside the Bickley Train Station. It makes it very dangerous for pedestrians, particularly vulnerable people, elderly and disabled people to get to the station entrance because the water is deep and unsanitary. People are forced to walk in the road into oncoming traffic There is no footpath opposite the flooded side.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southborough Road, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish not collected, 5th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 14, D'Arblay Street, Camden Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of Bags of Rubbish Dumped on Pavement, 5th September
item.description:
